com.github.macgregor.alexandria

Class PathFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.macgregor.alexandria.PathFinder

  • public class PathFinder
extends Object
    Find files along a set of directories that based on include/exclude patterns. Makes use of FileUtils.listFiles(File, IOFileFilter, IOFileFilter) to do most of the work.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PathFinder.GlobFileFilter
      File filter that matches glob patterns against absolute file paths.
      static class  PathFinder.RelativeFileFilter
      File filter that matches glob patterns relative to a set of base paths.

      • startingIn

        public PathFinder startingIn(String dir)
                      throws IOException
        Set starting directory to a single directory, converting it to a Path Path will be validated to be a directory that exists
        Parameters:
        dir - dir to use
        Returns:
        builder
        Throws:
        IOException - The path doesnt exist or is not a directory.

      • startingIn

        public PathFinder startingIn(Collection<String> dirs)
                      throws IOException
        Set the starting directories, converting the provided string paths into Path objects. Each path will be validated to be a directory that exists
        Parameters:
        dirs - dirs to use
        Returns:
        builder
        Throws:
        IOException - Any path doesnt exist or is not a directory.

      • recursive

        public PathFinder recursive(boolean isRecursive)
        When set, recursively walk directories when finding files. Default: true.
        Parameters:
        isRecursive - whether to use recursion or not
        Returns:
        builder

      • files

        public Collection<File> files()
        Find all files using the builder properties. Files will only be included if they match any of the include patterns and none of the exclude filters. Patterns can be wildcards against any file names (see WildcardFileFilter, specified relative to any startingDirs path (see PathFinder.RelativeFileFilter) or a glob pattern (see PathFinder.GlobFileFilter).
        Returns:
        List of matching File or an empty list.

      • paths

        public Collection<Path> paths()
        Same as files() but files are converted to Path objects before being returned.
        Returns:
        List of matching Path or an empty list.
